description: Michael Cohen came under a plodding cross-examination Tuesday by Donald Trump’s lawyer, who sought to undermine his earlier testimony that he participated in a hush money scheme to help the former president influence the 2016 election.
title: Cohen Says Trump Knew Checks Were for Hush-Money and Not Legal Work

description: Venezuela could withdraw an invitation to the European Union to oversee presidential elections after the group suspended some but not all sanctions on government officials.
title: Venezuela Weighs Withdrawing Invitation to EU Election Monitors

description: Russian President Vladimir Putin is heading to China for the first foreign visit of his new term, underlining the vital importance of the relationship as Beijing faces growing US pressure to curtail support that’s helping Moscow continue its war in Ukraine.
title: Putin Visits Ally Xi as US Threatens China Sanctions Over Ties

description: Interviews with dozens of government officials, childhood friends and former associates reveal how the prime minister’s core beliefs shape his decisions.
title: India’s Modi Is Preparing for a Thousand-Year Legacy

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, economics enterprise reporter Rich Miller looks at what to expect in tomorrow’s consumer price index report. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Inflation May Have Cooled, But It’s Not Enough Yet for the Fed

description: Zimbabwe’s cabinet has said more than half of the nation’s population of about 15 million people will immediately need food aid until March next year, as the country reels from the impact of the El Niño weather phenomenon that’s already slashed corn output and led to a national state of disaster being declared.
title: Zimbabwe’s Cabinet Says More Than Half of Population Needs Food Aid

description: China’s CMOC Group Ltd. is being accused by a top US official of using “predatory” tactics to depress prices of a key battery metal by flooding the market with cobalt from Democratic Republic of Congo mines.
title: US Blames China’s CMOC for Predatory Tactics Behind Cobalt Glut

description: The embattled head of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. vowed to overhaul the agency’s culture, eschewing calls to step down after a probe found that for years some employees endured sexual harassment and discrimination on the job.
title: FDIC’s Gruenberg Pledges to Fix Agency’s Culture Despite Exit Calls

description: Venezuela’s armed forces have moved “substantial quantities” of personnel and equipment near the disputed Essequibo region that’s controlled by Guyana, a Washington-based think tank reports, potentially escalating tensions ahead of presidential elections.
title: Venezuela Moves Substantial Troops to Guyana Border, Report Says

description: President Joe Biden just unveiled sweeping tariffs on a range of Chinese imports, including more than two dozen industrial raw materials. But the administration is being careful to avoid the critical minerals where Beijing’s grip on global supply is greatest.
title: US Tariffs on Minerals Leave Out Markets That China Dominates

description: Hunter Biden will go on trial as planned in June for violations of federal gun laws, a judge ruled.
title: Hunter Biden Fails to Delay Trial for Gun Offenses in Delaware

description: Donald Trump’s political career is marked by ruthlessly attacking his opponents in order to win, but thanks to his New York City criminal trial, he can’t do that. So he is turning to other Republicans to fight his battles.
title: Trump’s Newest Loyalty Test: Attending His NY Criminal Trial

description: One of the most prominent regional leaders of the far-right Alternative for Germany party was found guilty of using a Nazi slogan.
title: German Far-Right Politician Convicted in Trial Over Nazi Slogan

description: An Army ammunition plant in southeast Oklahoma is being expanded to at least triple monthly production of the US’s biggest non-nuclear bomb, a weapon often invoked in debates about a potential attack on deeply buried nuclear facilities in Iran or North Korea.
title: US to Boost Output of Bombs Designed to Hit Underground Nuclear Facilities

description: Jorge Alvarez Maynez, who’s running a distant third place in voter opinion polls in the run-up to Mexico’s presidential election, is facing increasing calls to bow out and throw his support to the main opposition coalition contender, Xochitl Galvez.
title: Mexico Candidate Maynez Faces Pressure to Cede Support to Galvez

description: Diplomats are focusing on a narrow set of goals in preparation for a summit on Ukraine’s peace plan in Switzerland next month to ensure China and other nations of the so-called Global South attend the meeting.
title: Ukraine Peace Plan Summit Eyes Minimal Goals to Woo Skeptical Global South

description: US President Joe Biden’s plan to hike tariffs on a broad range of Chinese imports takes a nuanced approach to solar equipment from the country.
title: Biden’s China Tariffs Offers Path for Some Solar Exemptions

description: Poland is turning more cautious on whether it’s really a good idea to pump fresh stimulus into a booming housing market.
title: Poland Forced to Rethink Cheap Mortgage Plan in a Housing Boom

description: Pro-Palestinian protesters at Harvard University are clearing out their weeks-long encampment without achieving their primary demand: forcing the school to cut its financial ties to Israel.
title: Harvard Protests End With Whimper as Israel Divestment Demands Fail

description: Ken Griffin, one of the most prolific supporters of Republicans across the US, said he’s waiting to see who Donald Trump picks as his running mate before backing his candidacy for president.
title: Ken Griffin Waits to See Trump’s VP Pick Before Backing Him

description: Andrey Belousov, Russia’s new defense minister, said he plans to improve military efficiency and reduce battlefield casualties to win the war in Ukraine that’s now in its third year with no end in sight.
title: Putin’s New Defense Chief Vows to Boost Army’s Efficiency in War

description: Canada’s corporate titans are helping the country’s Conservative Party build a financial war chest to oust Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, as frustration grows among business leaders about the country’s economic performance.
title: Finance Executives Help Canada’s Conservatives Crush Trudeau at the Money Game

description: Michael Cohen leaves for Manhattan Criminal Court in New York on May 14. Photographer: Timothy A. Clary/AFP/Getty Images
title: Michael Cohen Resumes Testimony at Trump Hush-Money Trial

description: Georgian lawmakers passed a bill against so-called foreign influence even as thousands protested outside the parliament against the measure that Western allies say is similar to a law Russia uses to crush dissent.
title: Georgia Lawmakers Pass ‘Foreign Agent’ Law, Defying Protests

description: Brazil’s central bank said more restrictive rates are needed to fulfill its commitment to hitting the inflation target, according to the minutes to its split decision on borrowing costs that rattled investors.
title: Brazil Central Bank Sees More Restrictive Monetary Policy After Split Vote on Rates

description: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Swedish Prime Minister Ulf Kristersson said the European Union must consider the benefits of trading with China as it mulls whether to follow the US’s lead by imposing import duties on electric vehicles.
title: Germany and Sweden Warn Against Following US Path on Chinese EVs

description: Exports fall as fewer cargoes are shipped from key Baltic ports
title: Russia’s Seaborne Crude Exports Plunge to a Two-Month Low

description: The UK summoned Chinese Ambassador Zheng Zeguang over allegations of foreign interference on British soil, in the latest escalation of friction between the two governments.
title: UK Summons Chinese Ambassador Over Allegations of Interference

description: At a conference convened by the International Energy Agency governments, multilateral lenders and oil and gas companies pledged $2.2 billion in new financing to promote clean cooking in Africa and end a scourge that kills 600,000 people on the continent a decade.
title: Governments, Firms Pledge $2.2 Billion for African Clean Cooking

description: Each day, Bloomberg journalists take you across a selection of towns and cities as they gear up for the big vote.
title: India’s Only Female State Head Hinders Modi’s Win in West Bengal

description: Ukraine’s military intelligence chief said his forces managed to “stabilize” the fallout from Russia’s fresh incursion into the country’s northeast as they seek to halt the sudden advance of Kremlin troops.
title: Ukraine Military Spy Chief Says Russian Kharkiv Push Has Slowed

description: Shares in Discovery Ltd. and other South African medical insurers slumped after President Cyril Ramaphosa said he’ll sign into law a new health bill that’s opposed by business.
title: Top South African Insurer Sinks as Ramaphosa to Sign Health Bill

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Putin and Zelenskiy Count On Friends in Wartime

description: Australia’s government unveiled what could be its pre-election budget, balancing election promises and spending cuts. Here are some of the winners and losers in Treasurer Jim Chalmers’ annual fiscal blueprint presented to parliament.
title: The Winners and Losers From Australia’s 2024-25 Budget

description: Russia detained another top Defense Ministry official on bribery allegations, the second case in less than a month as President Vladimir Putin shakes up his military leadership.
title: Russia Detains Second Defense Ministry Official in Bribery Case

description: Rishi Sunak’s government suffered a defeat by a single vote late Monday on a motion concerning bans for Members of Parliament accused of violent or sexual offenses, after Natalie Elphicke, who last week defected to the Labour Party from the prime minister’s Conservatives, sided with the opposition.
title: Tory Defector Casts Key Vote to Ban MPs Accused of Sex Assault

description: President Joe Biden is hiking tariffs on a wide range of Chinese imports — including semiconductors, batteries, solar cells, and critical minerals — in an election-year bid to bolster domestic manufacturing in critical industries.
title: Biden Imposes Tariffs on Chinese Chips, Critical Minerals, EVs

description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said his government won’t consider approving another casino in the Southeast Asian nation.
title: Malaysia Leader Anwar Says Nation Has No Need for Another Casino

description: Cease-fire talks between Israel and Hamas have reached an impasse following the Jewish state’s ground offensive on the outskirts of the Gazan city of Rafah, according to Qatari Prime Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al Thani.
title: Israel, Hamas Talks in Limbo After Rafah Move, Says Qatar PM

description: Ukraine needs two air defense batteries to shield Kharkiv from Russian attacks, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said after meeting US Secretary of State Antony Blinken.
title: Ukraine Needs Air Defense Batteries for Kharkiv, Zelenskiy Says

description: The European Union needs less complex regulation to help banks and investors fund the overhaul of its economy, Germany’s top financial watchdog said, while pushing back against calls to soften capital standards.
title: Europe Needs Simpler, Not Laxer Financial Rules, BaFin Says

description: Polish President Andrzej Duda said Russia will launch additional attacks if its forces aren’t prevented from victory in its war on Ukraine.
title: Polish President Says Russia Can’t Be Allowed to Win in Ukraine

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi filed his nomination papers to contest elections from Varanasi, a city in the northern state of Uttar Pradesh steeped in religious significance for the country’s Hindu majority.
title: Modi Files Papers to Contest Election From Holy City of Varanasi

description: Norway plans to spend more of its $1.6 trillion sovereign wealth fund than planned earlier, helping the Nordic nation’s economy overcome a soft patch amid an expected delay in interest rate cuts.
title: Norway Dials Up Spending of Oil Wealth as Inflation Worry Eases

description: The rand erased the year’s losses and South Africa’s benchmark stock index closed at the highest level in more than nine months as investors positioned for a market-friendly outcome in the May 29 election.
title: Rand Erases Losses on Optimism Over South African Vote Outcome

description: Emmanuel Macron spent Monday entertaining some of the biggest names from Wall Street at Versailles, while his government has been working on a series of measures to boost the country’s attractiveness to the financial services industry.
title: France Eyes More Wall Street Jobs After Versailles Rendezvous

description: Malaysia’s Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim met with a Hamas delegation during his visit to Qatar, in a fresh show of support for the group designated a terrorist organization by the US.
title: Malaysia PM Meets Hamas Chief in Qatar in Show of Support

description: The Kremlin’s appointment of an economist to run the defense ministry is a sign of grandiose intent
title: Putin's Preparing Better Than Us for a Long War

description: Belgium and the Netherlands struggle with drug-related violence as they step up port security
title: Cocaine Superhighway Brings Drugs and Violence to Europe

description: Turkey’s move to cut public spending in a bid to curb rampant inflation was largely shrugged off by investors, with questions raised over how much would actually be saved and what difference the reductions would make.
title: Turkey Underwhelms With New Spending Cuts to Curb Inflation

description: Secretary of State Antony Blinken arrived in Kyiv on Tuesday to reinforce US support after delays in billions of dollars of military aid forced Ukraine to ration munitions and prompted fears the US would abandon its partner in the face of Russia’s invasion.
title: Blinken Visits Ukraine in Effort to Assure Kyiv of US Backing

description: Hong Kong’s leader condemned the UK’s move to charge three men with assisting an intelligence service from the city, underscoring tensions between the Asian finance hub and the British government.
title: Hong Kong Condemns UK’s Spying Allegations Against Trade Officer

description: Japanese Minister of Finance Shunichi Suzuki stressed the importance of coordination and collaboration between the government and the Bank of Japan to ensure they don’t hinder each other in pursuing their policy objectives.
title: Japan’s Suzuki Sees Need to Keep Close Coordination With BOJ
